text: General Council elections were held in French Ivory Coast (which included Upper Volta at the time) in December 1946 and 5 January 1947. The Democratic Party of Ivory Coast – African Democratic Rally won all 15 seats in the Second College in Ivory Coast,Dolf Sternberger, Bernhard Vogel, Dieter Nohlen & Klaus Landfried (1978) Die Wahl der Parlamente: Band II: Afrika, Erster Halbband, p679 and 24 of the 30 Second College seats overall. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !rowspan=2|Party !colspan=3|First round !colspan=3|Second round !rowspan=2|Total seats |- !Votes !% !Seats !Votes !% !Seats |- !colspan=8|First College |- |align=left|National Union|| || ||5|| || ||8||13 |- |align=left|Filidori List|| || ||0|| || ||6||6 |- |align=left|URDIESCI|| || ||0|| || ||1||1 |- |align=left|Total||2,069||100||5|| || ||15||20 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||4,449||46.5||–|| || ||–||– |- !colspan=8|Second College |- |align=left|Democratic Party of Ivory Coast – African Democratic Rally|| || ||24||rowspan=2 colspan=3| ||24 |- |align=left|Independents|| || ||6||6 |- |align=left|Total||132,848||100||30||–||–||–||30 |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||209,325||63.4||–||–||–||–||– |- |align=left colspan=8|Source: De BenoistJoseph-Roger de Benoist (1982) Afrique occidentale française de 1944 à 1960, pp536–537 |} ==Aftermath== When Upper Volta was reconstituted as a separate territory in 1948, its members left the General Council (10 from the First College, 15 from the Second). By-elections were held in May 1948 for eight First College seats and 12 Second College seats; the PDCI won all of the Second College seats.Sternberger et al., p654 ==References== Category:1946 elections in Africa Category:1946 in French Upper Volta Category:1946 in Ivory Coast Category:1947 elections in Africa Category:1947 in French Upper Volta Category:1947 in Ivory Coast 1946 1946 1946 Category:December 1946 events Category:January 1947 events
title: 1946–47 Ivorian General Council election
